title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A gripping coming-of-age story set in 1930s Alabama, exploring themes of racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of Scout Finch.
A dystopian masterpiece about totalitarianism, surveillance, and the power of language in a society where Big Brother watches everything.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A witty romance following Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates love, family, and social expectations in Regency England.

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A haunting tale of the American Dream set in the Jazz Age, following Jay Gatsby's obsessive pursuit of love and status.

title: The Alchemist
description: A magical fable about following your dreams, as a shepherd boy journeys from Spain to Egypt in search of treasure.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: The beginning of the magical journey as Harry Potter discovers he's a wizard and enters the enchanting world of Hogwarts.

title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
description: The epic fantasy adventure begins as Frodo embarks on a quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: Holden Caulfield's unforgettable journey through New York City as he grapples with growing up and finding his place in the world.

title: Jane Eyre
description: A powerful story of an orphaned girl's journey to independence, love, and self-respect in Victorian England.

title: Animal Farm
description: A brilliant allegory about a group of farm animals who rebel against their human farmer, hoping to create an equal society.

title: The Hobbit
description: Bilbo Baggins' unexpected adventure with thirteen dwarves and a wizard to reclaim their homeland from a dragon.

title: Brave New World
description: A chilling vision of a future society where happiness is manufactured and individuality is discouraged.

title: Of Mice and Men
description: A touching story of friendship between two migrant workers during the Great Depression in California.

title: The Lord of the Flies
description: A gripping tale of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island and their attempt to govern themselves.

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: A dystopian future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found, following one man's awakening.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: The timeless tragedy of star-crossed lovers whose deaths ultimately unite their feuding families.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
description: The powerful and moving diary of a young Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis during World War II.

title: Wuthering Heights
description: A passionate and destructive love story set on the Yorkshire moors, exploring themes of revenge and redemption.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
description: Four children discover a magical world through a wardrobe, where they must help defeat the White Witch.

title: The Little Prince
description: A poetic tale about a young prince who visits various planets in space, meeting curious inhabitants.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
description: A powerful story of rebellion against institutional authority set in a mental hospital.

title: The Kite Runner
description: A haunting tale of friendship, guilt, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history.

title: The Book Thief
description: Death narrates the story of Liesel, a young girl living with foster parents in Nazi Germany who steals books.

title: The Giver
description: A thought-provoking dystopian novel about a boy who discovers the truth about his seemingly perfect society.

title: Life of Pi
description: An extraordinary story of survival as a young boy is stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
description: A chilling dystopian tale of a society where women have lost all their rights and freedoms.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
description: A touching love story between two teenagers who meet in a cancer support group.

title: Moby-Dick
description: Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale that destroyed his ship and took his leg.

title: Great Expectations
description: Young Pip's journey from blacksmith's apprentice to gentleman, learning about love, loyalty, and true worth.

title: Frankenstein
description: The gothic tale of Victor Frankenstein's creation of life and the monster that haunts his existence.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: Huck's adventures as he travels down the Mississippi River with runaway slave Jim.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: The psychological journey of Raskolnikov after he commits murder in St. Petersburg.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A young man's portrait ages while he remains beautiful, exploring themes of vanity and moral corruption.

title: The Secret Garden
description: A spoiled girl discovers a hidden garden and learns about friendship, healing, and growth.

title: Charlotte's Web
description: The friendship between a pig named Wilbur and a spider named Charlotte who saves his life.

title: Where the Red Fern Grows
description: A boy's determination to get hunting dogs and the adventures that follow in the Ozark Mountains.

title: Holes
description: Stanley Yelnats is sent to a detention center where boys dig holes all day in the desert.

title: A Wrinkle in Time
description: Meg Murry travels through time and space to rescue her father from the forces of evil.

title: The Outsiders
description: The rivalry between two gangs and the bonds of brotherhood among teenage outcasts.

title: The Hunger Games
description: Katniss Everdeen volunteers to take her sister's place in a televised fight to the death.

title: Divergent
description: In a divided society, Tris discovers she's Divergent and uncovers a conspiracy to destroy all Divergents.

title: The Maze Runner
description: Thomas wakes up in a maze with no memory, surrounded by other boys trying to find a way out.

title: Dune
description: Paul Atreides leads a rebellion on the desert planet Arrakis to control the universe's most valuable substance.

title: Ender's Game
description: A brilliant child is trained in a military school to fight an alien invasion.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
description: Arthur Dent's absurd adventures through space after Earth is destroyed to make way for a highway.

title: Foundation
description: Hari Seldon creates a foundation to preserve knowledge and shorten the coming dark age.

title: Gone Girl
description: When Amy disappears on her wedding anniversary, all evidence points to her husband Nick.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
description: A journalist and a hacker investigate a wealthy family's dark secrets in Sweden.

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: Robert Langdon follows clues hidden in Da Vinci's paintings to uncover a religious mystery.

title: In Cold Blood
description: The true crime masterpiece about the brutal murder of a Kansas family and its aftermath.

title: The Color Purple
description: Celie's journey from abuse to empowerment in the American South of the 1930s.

title: Beloved
description: A former slave is haunted by the spirit of her daughter in this powerful exploration of trauma and memory.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
description: The Joad family's journey from Oklahoma to California during the Great Depression.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: The multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the magical town of Macondo.

title: Love in the Time of Cholera
description: A sweeping love story that spans over fifty years in Caribbean Colombia.

title: The Sun Also Rises
description: American and British expatriates travel from Paris to Pamplona for the running of the bulls.

title: For Whom the Bell Tolls
description: An American fighting in the Spanish Civil War falls in love during a dangerous mission.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
description: An aging Cuban fisherman struggles with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.

title: A Farewell to Arms
description: A love story between an American ambulance driver and an English nurse during World War I.

title: Catch-22
description: A satirical novel about the absurdity of war, following bombardier Yossarian in World War II.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
description: Billy Pilgrim becomes unstuck in time and experiences the bombing of Dresden.

title: On the Road
description: Sal Paradise and Dean Moriarty travel across America in search of meaning and adventure.

title: The Bell Jar
description: Esther Greenwood's descent into mental illness in 1950s New York and Boston.

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
description: Charlie navigates his freshman year of high school through letters to an anonymous friend.

title: Looking for Alaska
description: Miles goes to boarding school and falls in love with the enigmatic Alaska Young.

title: Thirteen Reasons Why
description: Clay receives cassette tapes from his classmate Hannah who died by suicide, explaining why.

title: The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian
description: Junior leaves his troubled school on the Spokane Indian Reservation to attend an all-white farm town school.

title: Monster
description: Sixteen-year-old Steve Harmon is on trial for murder and writes his experience as a movie script.

title: Speak
description: Melinda struggles with the aftermath of a traumatic event during her freshman year of high school.

title: The House on Mango Street
description: Esperanza Cordero comes of age in a Latino neighborhood in Chicago.

title: Educated
description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a survivalist family and eventually earns a PhD from Cambridge.

title: Becoming
description: The former First Lady's memoir chronicling her journey from Chicago's South Side to the White House.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
description: An exploration of how Homo sapiens came to dominate the world through cognitive, agricultural, and scientific revolutions.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
description: A guide to personal and professional effectiveness based on timeless principles.

title: Atomic Habits
description: A comprehensive guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones through small changes.

title: The Midnight Library
description: Nora finds herself in a magical library between life and death, exploring alternate versions of her life.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
description: Kya, the 'Marsh Girl,' grows up isolated in the North Carolina marshlands and becomes a murder suspect.

title: Circe
description: The story of the Greek goddess Circe, from her discovery of witchcraft to her encounters with famous mythological figures.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
description: Reclusive Hollywood icon Evelyn Hugo finally reveals the truth about her scandalous life to a young journalist.

title: The Song of Achilles
description: The love story between Achilles and Patroclus during the Trojan War, told from Patroclus's perspective.

title: Normal People
description: The complex relationship between Connell and Marianne from high school through college in Ireland.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
description: In 1990s Ohio, the arrival of a mysterious artist and her daughter upends a suburban community.

title: The Silent Patient
description: A psychotherapist becomes obsessed with treating a woman who murdered her husband and then never spoke again.

title: Big Little Lies
description: Three women become entangled in a web of lies that leads to a shocking death at a school trivia night.

title: The Girl on the Train
description: Rachel takes the same commuter train every morning until she becomes entangled in a missing person investigation.

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
description: Eleanor's carefully ordered life begins to change when she develops a crush and befriends a coworker.

title: A Man Called Ove
description: A grumpy yet loveable man finds his solitary world turned upside down by his boisterous new neighbors.

title: The Hate U Give
description: Starr witnesses the fatal shooting of her unarmed friend Khalil by police and finds her voice as an activist.

title: Children of Blood and Bone
description: Zélie fights to restore magic to her oppressed people in this West African-inspired fantasy.

title: The Cruel Prince
description: Jude, a human girl, navigates the treacherous High Court of Faerie where she doesn't belong.

title: Six of Crows
description: A crew of six outcasts attempts an impossible heist in the bustling city of Ketterdam.

title: The Poppy War
description: Rin discovers her deadly power when war comes to her country in this grimdark military fantasy.

title: Educated
description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a survivalist family and eventually earns a PhD from Cambridge.

title: The Immortalists
description: Four siblings visit a fortune teller who tells them the dates of their deaths, changing their lives forever.

title: An American Marriage
description: A newlywed couple's life is upended when the husband is wrongly imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit.

title: The Water Will Come
description: An urgent examination of how rising seas will reshape our world and what we can do about it.

title: Hillbilly Elegy
description: A memoir about growing up in a poor Rust Belt town and the Appalachian values that shaped the author.

title: Born a Crime
description: The comedian's memoir about growing up in South Africa during and after apartheid.

title: The Power
description: Women develop the ability to generate electrical shocks, fundamentally altering the balance of power in society.

title: Station Eleven
description: A post-apocalyptic novel following interconnected characters before and after a devastating flu pandemic.
